headline.main: TOPICS OF THE DAY IN WALL STREET

docs.snippet: Lower tariff rates in accord with agreements reached at the Annecy Trade Conference last spring and summer are due this week with the expected announcement by President Truman of duty cuts on some 400 items, it was indicated in foreign trade circles...
docs.lead_paragraph: Lower tariff rates in accord with agreements reached at the Annecy Trade Conference last spring and summer are due this week with the expected announcement by President Truman of duty cuts on some 400 items, it was indicated in foreign trade circles here last week.

headline.main: TARIFF REDUCTIONS ARE DUE THIS WEEK; Importers Say Announcement Under Reciprocal Trade Act May Cut Duty on 400 Items

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Oct. 9 -- Thirty-one countries representing twenty-eight customs areas released new customs tariff schedules today incorporating the results of the summer-long trade conference held at Annecy, France.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Oct. 9 -- Thirty-one countries representing twenty-eight customs areas released new customs tariff schedules today incorporating the results of the summer-long trade conference held at Annecy, France.
docs.abstract: significant cuts made as nations release Annecy schedules

headline.main: 31 NATIONS PUBLISH DUTY CUTS AIMED AT SPURRING TRADE; 80% of Global Sellers Take Part in Common Revisions Downward of Customs ANNECY SUCCESS HAILED U. S. Gets, Gives Concessions -- Signing of Protocol Begins Today at Lake Success 31 NATIONS PUBLISH CUT TARIFF RATES

byline.original: By MICHAEL L. HOFFMANSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Oct. 7, 1949.

docs.snippet: Representatives of industry sought to appraise yesterday competitive effects of the Annecy tariff reductions but few immediate major complaints appeared. However, Richard H. Anthony, secretary of the American Tariff League, charged that many of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Representatives of industry sought to appraise yesterday competitive effects of the Annecy tariff reductions but few immediate major complaints appeared. However, Richard H. Anthony, secretary of the American Tariff League, charged that many of the new reductions have been compounded to 75 per cent of the 1930 tariff rate.
docs.abstract: US indus reaction; Amer Tariff League sec R H Anthony comments

headline.main: INDUSTRY SEEKING TARIFF APPRAISALS; Few Major Complaints Heard -- Anthony Sees Many Cuts Compounded to 75% of '30 INDUSTRY SEEKING TARIFF APPRAISALS

docs.snippet: Hearings on the application of Moore-McCormack Lines for resumption of an operating differential subsidy on its three passenger vessels in service between New York and the east coast of South America will be closed in Washington on Tuesday, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hearings on the application of Moore-McCormack Lines for resumption of an operating differential subsidy on its three passenger vessels in service between New York and the east coast of South America will be closed in Washington on Tuesday, the Maritime Commission announced esterda The vessels involved are the Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay.
docs.abstract: hearing nears end; comm repts change in bareboat charter rules

headline.main: Shipping News and Notes; Hearings End on Moore-McCormack Application for Resumption of Subsidy

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, Oct. 14 -- A fifty-nine member committee of the United Nations General Assembly overruled strong United States and British protests today and voted to require colonial authorities in areas under the international trusteeship system to...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, Oct. 14 -- A fifty-nine member committee of the United Nations General Assembly overruled strong United States and British protests today and voted to require colonial authorities in areas under the international trusteeship system to submit within one year concrete blueprints showing how millions of African and Pacific natives were to achieve self-government or independence.
docs.abstract: com approves moves over US and Brit objections, 24-10

headline.main: U. N. TRUSTEE BODY INSISTS ON REPORT; Assembly Unit Overrides U. S., Britain in Call for Data on Colonial People's Freedom

docs.snippet: One of these days soon there will be placed before a plenary meeting of the United Nations General Assembly a one-sentence proposal known as Rule 56 (a). All signs now point to its ultimate approval.
docs.lead_paragraph: One of these days soon there will be placed before a plenary meeting of the United Nations General Assembly a one-sentence proposal known as Rule 56 (a). All signs now point to its ultimate approval.
docs.abstract: Comment on proposal to adopt uniform World Calendar, UN; cites poll of delegates by Assn

docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly decided yesterday at Flushing Meadow to shelve its half-completed treaty on freedom of information -- at least until the 1950 session.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly decided yesterday at Flushing Meadow to shelve its half-completed treaty on freedom of information -- at least until the 1950 session.
docs.abstract: UN Assembly tables information freedom pact, 38-10; France leads opposition; cites USSR policy reversal

headline.main: INFORMATION PACT IS SHELVED BY U. N.; Assembly Votes to Postpone Work on Half-Completed Treaty by 38 to 10
